title: Explore the Top Ten Hill Stations in Uttarakhand
text: Explore the Top Ten Hill Stations in Uttarakhand Explore the Top Ten Hill Stations in Uttarakhand 0 Uttarakhand is a state that is full of major attractions for tourists. Since numerous Hindu temples can be found across the whole state, it is also called the Devbhumi which means the land of Gods. Due to this reason this state sees a number of pilgrims from across the country. Tibet shares one of its borders, which again makes it a significant state in terms of religion tourism. The state comprises of a number of tourist sites and hence it sees a huge influx of travelers from across the nation. Nainital hosts the High Court of the state and it is the major city of the whole region. Nainital is an important city of Uttarakhand and hence it is hub of engagements. Due to its importance, there are is a comprehensive Nainital hotels list to help you choose your accommodation in the best of ways. Uttarakhand is bestowed with the best of natural scenery and beauty. The valleys, the places, and the hills are truly exotic and worth a visit. The hills in Uttarakhand are worth your experience if you want to bask in the peace of the hills. If you are looking for the best offbeat places in Uttarakhand, you can simply look at the top ten hill stations which are listed as follows: Mussoorie Tourism Mussoorie - A typically hilly region, Mussoorie is a great place to spend some time amidst the hills and the fresh air that blows through this town. This place is often called the Queen of the Hills. Mussoorie is best known for trekking, night safari, and birdwatching. Nainital - It is the most popular hill station in Uttarakhand. A breathtaking valley full of natural scenery, Nainital is also religious site which is considered one of the Shaktipeeths that lies across India. Bhimtal - Bhimtal is a great summer destination to cool off the soaring heat that one experiences in the city. It is lush green and offers an exotic view for your relaxation and rejuvenation. Champawat - This place has a rich cultural heritage and it is a historical place with a lot of architecture that has an essence of the gone era. Baleshwar and Nagnath temples are ample evidences of this fact. Dhanaulti - This is a major attraction in Uttarakhand. Located considerable close to Mussoorie, this hill station is full of thrills for visitors. Flying Fox, Burma Bridge, Joranda Falls, etc. are great places for recreation and enjoyment. Pangot - Just 15 km from Nainital, Pangot is a perfect destination for tourists who like birdwatching and wildlife photography. Almora - It is a nice place full of natural beauty. It is a favourite among the vacationers and honeymooners. It also hosts the Nanda Devi temple which is a major attraction of devout tourists. Auli - If you like snow and skiing, Auli is the place to be at. The Deodars and the Oaks just add to its beauty. Chamba - It is a charming place and hosts five wildlife reserves. Chamba is truly romantic destination in monsoons and winters, and a site of rejuvenation during the winters. Chopta - This place is famous for adventurous activities and offers some exciting trekking opportunities. Forests of rhododendrons make it further beautiful. It is a hill station worth a visit during September to November. Explore these offbeat places in Uttarakhand and stay for a couple of weeks to know the place more exclusively.
